Dispute_Type: Procedural dispute over filing of reply affidavit
Legal_Issue: Whether an applicant can file a reply affidavit in response to the respondent's affidavits when not explicitly permitted by Federal Court Rules
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to justify filing of supplementary affidavit
Legal_Rule: Rule 321.1, Rule 319, Rule 1603 of the Federal Court Rules
Standard_of_Review: Interpretation of procedural rules and discretion to allow supplementary filings
Procedural_Issue: Filing of reply affidavit without explicit rule authorization
Grounds_for_Claim: Applicant sought to respond to new facts in respondent's affidavits
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court considered whether refusal would compromise fairness
Legal_Framework: Federal Court Rules, case law on supplementary affidavits
Applicant_Challenge: Right to respond to respondent's affidavits
Court_Result: Reply affidavit dismissed for non-compliance with rules
Defendant_Response: Opposed the filing of the reply affidavit as procedurally improper
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Filing not authorized by rules; no leave obtained
Applicable_Process: Judicial review under Federal Court Rules
Governing_Rule: Federal Court Rules, Rule 1603 and related provisions
